meanings.definition: To descend a rock face or other near-vertical surface by using a doubled rope coiled around the body and fixed at a higher point.
meanings.sent1: I will abseil down the cliff during our outdoor adventure.
meanings.sent2: The experienced climber decided to abseil to the base of the mountain.
meanings.sent3: As I abseil down, I feel like a superhero on a mission.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence soared as she began to abseil down the steep slope.
meanings.sent5: The thrill of abseiling made the whole experience unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A descent using a doubled rope coiled around the body and fixed at a higher point.
meanings.sent1: During the expedition, we had to perform an abseil to reach the bottom safely.
meanings.sent2: The instructor demonstrated the proper technique for an abseil.
meanings.sent3: The abseil equipment looked like something out of a spy movie.
meanings.sent4: The abseil down the waterfall felt like a controlled free fall.
meanings.sent5: The team cheered as the last member completed the abseil successfully.
